SENT.plain: The aim of this retrospective study was to assess respiratory and cardiac function in a large cohort of patients with congenital muscular dystrophies (CMD) with reduced glycosylation of alphadystroglycan (Î±-DG)
Thirteen of the 115 patients included in the study died between the age of 1 month and 20 years
The age at last follow up of the surviving 102 ranged between 1 year and 68 years (median: 9.3 years)
Cardiac involvement was found in 7 of the 115 (6%), 5 with dilated cardiomyopathy, 1 cardiac conductions defects and 1 mitral regurgitation
Ten of the 14 required non invasive nocturnal respiratory support, while the other four required invasive ventilation
Cardiac or respiratory involvement was found in patients with mutations in FKRP, POMT1, POMT2
All of the patients in whom mutation in POMGnT1 were identified had normal cardiac and respiratory function
